entry.et: Middle English, from Old English bedd; akin to Old High German betti bed, Latin fodere to dig

def.dt: :a piece of furniture on or in which to lie and sleep
:a place of sex relations
:marital relationship
:close association :cahoots a legislator in bed with lobbyists
:a place for sleeping
:sleep
:a time for sleeping took a walk before bed
:a mattress filled with soft material
:bedstead
:the equipment and services needed to care for one hospitalized patient or hotel guest
:a flat or level surface: as
:a plot of ground prepared for plants
:the plants grown in such a plot
:the bottom of a body of water
:an area of sea bottom supporting a heavy growth of a particular organism an oyster bed
:a supporting surface or structure :foundation
:layer stratum
:the place or material in which a block or brick is laid
:the lower surface of a brick, slate, or tile
:a mass or heap resembling a bed a bed of ashes served on a bed of lettuce
:in the act of sexual intercourse
:to find or make sleeping accommodations usually used with down a place to bed down
:to go to bed usually used with down bed down at midnight
:to form a layer
:to lie flat or flush
:to furnish with a bed or bedding :settle in sleeping quarters often used with down
:to put, take, or send to bed
:embed
:to plant or arrange in beds
:base establish
:to lay flat or in a layer
:to make a bed in or of
:to have sexual intercourse with
bachelor of education
:an establishment (as an inn) offering lodging and breakfast
:a night inspection to check the presence of persons (as soldiers) required by regulations to be in bed or in quarters
:sleep around
:the molding of a cornice below the corona and above the frieze
:a molding below a deep projection
:a place or situation of agreeable ease
:confinement of a sick person to bed

entry.et: bed-sitting room + -er (as in fresher freshman, rugger rugby)

def.dt: :a one-room apartment serving as both bedroom and sitting room called also bedsit bed-sitting-room
